title: Loss of Spanish airport contracts hits John Menzies profits
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 09:09 BST - UK Markets close in 7 hrs 21 mins Loss of Spanish airport contracts hits John Menzies profits By Jon Yeomans | Telegraph – 5 minutes ago +7.60 
The aviation and newspaper distribution company is looking to rebuild after recent contract losses 
The “disappointing” loss of a major contract with Spanish airports has hit profits at Edinburgh-based John Menzies (LSE: MNZS.L - news ) . 
The aviation support services and newspaper distribution company lost its bid to renew baggage-handling contracts in Spain, resulting in an impairment charge of £4.7m. 
Changes to its operations at Heathrow airport and other restructuring charges also took a toll, pushing group pre-tax profit in the six months to June 30 down to £5.8m from £14.2m a year earlier. 
Revenues at John Menzies grew to £954.1m from £944.4m last year. 
The company, which issued a profit warning last November because of problems in its aviation business, said revenue in the division nonetheless grew 8pc in the first-half. 
It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) pointed to 49 contract wins that it hopes will offset contract losses elsewhere, including deals with United Airlines, Frontier Airlines, and Norwegian Air Shuttle (Oslo: NASFUT.OL - news ) , and the renewal of a ground-handling contract with easyJet. 
John Menzies’ distribution arm also outperformed management expectations, with cost savings and rationalisation helping offset continuing long-term decline in newspaper and magazine sales. Sales of newspapers were down 4pc on a like-for-like basis, while magazines declined 5pc, although these were partly mitigated by cover price rises. 
"Our transition plans are on track and progressing well, although the first half of the year has been challenging as we continue to address the operational issues that arose during 2014,” said Jeremy Stafford, chief executive. 
“In terms of group full-year performance, as we previously highlighted, profits will have a greater second half weighting this year as we continue to transition the business. There is a great deal of potential across the business and we remain on track." 
Mr Stafford added that John Menzies was looking to grow its presence in the e-commerce parcel market following the acquisition of Highlands-based AJG Parcels for £7.5m in June. 
The introduction of the new national living wage , announced by the Chancellor in the summer Budget, would hit employment costs primarily in its distribution business, the company added, but it was “considering a range of mitigating actions”.
